subject: Career
title: Pay Transparency Laws Are Changing Everything
description: One-minute skill: Pay Transparency Laws Are Changing Everything.

hook.text: Colorado, New York, and California now require salary ranges in job postings. The game is changing.

buildup.text: Pay transparency shifts power to candidates. You can see the range before you even apply.

discovery.text: When ranges are public, anchoring shifts. You negotiate within a known band, not in the dark.

twist.text: Some companies post absurdly wide ranges ($80K-$180K) to comply technically while revealing nothing.

climax.text: Still, the trend is clear: secrecy is fading. Leverage now comes from market data, not mystery.

punchline.text: When everyone sees the range, the best negotiator still wins.

quiz.question: How do pay transparency laws affect salary negotiation?
options: Candidates see ranges before applying, shifting power
They only apply to government jobs
